commentary_data: Squad: Rohit Sharma(c), Dewald Brevis, Ramandeep Singh, Tilak Varma, Suryakumar Yadav, Ishan Kishan(w), Tristan Stubbs, Tim David, Cameron Green, Shams Mulani, Piyush Chawla, Kumar Kartikeya, Hrithik Shokeen, Arjun Tendulkar, Jofra Archer, Arshad Khan, Jason Behrendorff, Sandeep Warrier, Akash Madhwal, Duan Jansen, Vishnu Vinod, Nehal Wadhera, Raghav Goyal

Squad: Faf du Plessis(c), Virat Kohli, Suyash Prabhudessai, Dinesh Karthik(w), Anuj Rawat, Manoj Bhandage, Glenn Maxwell, Mahipal Lomror, Michael Bracewell, Shahbaz Ahmed, David Willey, Harshal Patel, Siddarth Kaul, Karn Sharma, Reece Topley, Mohammed Siraj, Sonu Yadav, Akash Deep, Rajan Kumar, Avinash Singh, Finn Allen, Himanshu Sharma

Hello and a warm welcome to the second game of todays double header where Royal Challengers Bangalore will play hosts to Mumbai Indians at the M Chinnaswamy Stadium. The fans have eagerly missed IPL action in Bengaluru since before the pandemic and this season expect a huge sea of red amongst the crowd chanting RCB, RCB, at the top of their voices. RCB have had quite a consistent run in the IPL in the last three seasons, reaching the playoffs every single time. On the other hand, MI struggled last year after the mega auction as they finished at the bottom of the table.

Now, let’s analyse the strengths and weaknesses of both these sides. To start with, both teams have injury concerns and are missing a few key players. RCB will miss Hazlewood, Hasaranga, and Patidar. Hazlewood and Patidar are recovering from injuries while Hasaranga is on national duty. Mumbai Indians have to do without Jasprit Bumrah and Jhye Richardson. RCB are top-heavy and rely a lot on Kohli and du Plessis. The addition of Bracewell though does give them a good all-round option. They do have good variety in their pace attack but they would strive to be more economical.

MI signed Cameron Green and that does solidify them. The fact that Archer is fully fit, MI would want him to rise to the occasion. Rohit Sharma has been a bit off-colour with the bat in the last few seasons of the IPL and MI would want him to lead from the front. Their bowling does look a bit short on experience but it also presents an opportunity for new stars to emerge. The bright thing for the visitors is that they have a terrific record at this venue – with 10 wins and only three losses. Will MI once again shine in Bengaluru? Or will RCB put up a clinical display in front of their home crowd? Expect a run-feast as the boundaries are short and the pitch can well be a belter. Toss and team lineups will come out in a while..

We are going to bowl first. There's a bit of weather around. There has been a bit of dew in the practice games too. (Four overseas players)  We have been so excited to get started to tonight. This is one of the great stadiums to play cricket in. That's a long way again. The first goal is to make the playoffs. We have to make sure we get off to a good start, 14 games to go in the tournament, and then we can talk about that.

With this new rule teams are backing themselves to chase. At the end of the day you have to play good cricket to win. We know we have to bat first here. The pitch looks good, we just have to come out with positive intent. (Overseas players)  Last season was a disappointment for us but again, we know exactly where we went wrong so we will try and correct those mistakes. We have got some new faces as well so hopefully those guys play freely and express themselves. (On playing his 200th T20 game as captain) Exciting, I am really honored and grateful as well. It's been a long journey and it's something I will cherish. Look forward to playing many more games and hopefully we can achieve what we want. to achieve.
(Playing XI): Rohit Sharma(c), Ishan Kishan(w), Suryakumar Yadav, Cameron Green, Tilak Varma, Tim David, Nehal Wadhera, Hrithik Shokeen, Piyush Chawla, Jofra Archer, Arshad Khan
(Playing XI): Virat Kohli, Faf du Plessis(c), Glenn Maxwell, Michael Bracewell, Shahbaz Ahmed, Dinesh Karthik(w), Karn Sharma, Harshal Patel, Akash Deep, Reece Topley, Mohammed Siraj
There is a minute's silence for Salim Durani who passed away today. He was the first Indian cricketer to get the Arjuna Award.
Jason Behrendorff, Vishnu Vinod, Shams Mulani, Sandeep Warrier, Ramandeep Singh.
Anuj Rawat, Suyash Prabhudessai, Mahipal Lomror, Sonu Yadav, David Willey.

The players and the umpires make their way out to the middle. Rohit Sharma and Ishan Kishan would be eyeing to provide MI a good start. Mohammed Siraj to start off the proceedings with the ball. A slip in place. Here we go..
Siraj to Rohit, 1 run, back of a length ball on leg, Rohit is a bit cramped up but manages to pull it away towards deep square leg to get going
Siraj to Ishan Kishan, no run, back of a length ball on off, Ishan Kishan camps back and eases it towards cover point
Siraj to Ishan Kishan, no run, on a length around leg, Ishan Kishan looks to turn it across but is hit high on the pads
Siraj to Ishan Kishan, no run, fuller length ball around off, a bit of nibble in the air, Ishan Kishan covers the line and eases it towards mid-on
Siraj to Ishan Kishan, 1 run, back of a length ball slanting across Ishan Kishan as he places it to deep backward point for a run
Siraj to Rohit, no run, good length ball outside off, a bit of extra bounce on that, played with an angled bat towards backward point
Topley to Ishan Kishan, , well played! Pitched up ball outside off, swinging away, Ishan Kishan reaches out to it and caresses it through cover point for a glorious boundary
Topley to Ishan Kishan, no run, fuller lengh ball around off, a bit of away shape on that, Ishan Kishan leans ahead and blocks it towards covers
Topley to Ishan Kishan, no run, fuller lengh ball around off, a bit of away shape on that, Ishan Kishan leans ahead and blocks it towards covers

Topley to Ishan Kishan, no run,  Full ball outside off, driven crisply towards covers where the fielder dives to his right to make a brilliant stop. Rohit had taken off and has to turn back. But, the shy misses at the bowler's end. Rohit was not even in the frame
Topley to Ishan Kishan, , full ball outside off, Ishan Kishan creams it uppishly and it just goes past the leaping fielder at covers. Runs through to the fence
Topley to Ishan Kishan, no run, back of a length ball outside off, punched off the back foot to covers
Topley to Ishan Kishan, 1 run, another back of a length ball outside off, Ishan Kishan steers it down to third man to keep strike

Siraj to Ishan Kishan, no run, on a length around leg, Ishan Kishan looks to flick it away but misses. Siraj appeals for an lbw but the umpire stays put. Faf signals to him that it might have pitched outside leg
Siraj to Ishan Kishan, no run, Siraj once again gets some shape back in from a fuller length. Ishan Kishan looks to counter it tentatively but is hit on the pads
Siraj to Ishan Kishan,  Caught!!

Siraj to Ishan Kishan,  Caught by Harshal Patel!!  The crowd makes a huge noise. On a length around off, Ishan Kishan looks to pick it up over square leg but gets it off the outer half of the bat. The ball flies towards third man. Harshal in the deep takes a well-judged catch near the fence.
Siraj to Green, 1 run, back of a length ball around off, Green punches it towards mid-off to get a single
Siraj to Rohit, no run, in the tight off stump channel, seams away a touch, Rohit covers the line and dabs it into the off-side
Siraj to Rohit, no run, pitched up ball, shaping in a touch, Rohit comes half-forward and eases it to mid-on
Topley to Green, , shot! Full ball outside off, Green plants his front foot across and drills it through covers for a rocketing boundary
Topley to Green, no run, full ball around leg, swinging in, Green looks to flick it away but is hit on the pads
Topley to Green,  Bowled!!

Topley to Green,  Bowled!!  He bowls a very full ball around off and gets it to swing in. Green looks to drive it through covers with minimal foot movement but only manages to get a thick inside edge which crashes into the stumps. Topley is cock-a-hoop! An ideal start for RCB. Joy for Topley whereas disappointment for Green.
Topley to Suryakumar Yadav, no run, fuller length ball slanting across Suryakumar Yadav. He plants his front foot across and defends it towards point
Sky has been in horrid form in ODIs. He registered three consecutive golden ducks against Australia recently
Sky has been in horrid form in ODIs. He registered three consecutive golden ducks against Australia recently
Topley to Suryakumar Yadav, no run, back of a length ball outside off, Suryakumar Yadav hangs back and places it towards point

Topley to Suryakumar Yadav, 1 run, good length ball around off, Suryakumar Yadav with minimal foot movement punches it towards mid-off for a single. That will give him some relief. The ball swinging in on the tight off-stump channel caused him worries against Starc recently
Siraj to Suryakumar Yadav, , Siraj slips this one down the leg side, Suryakumar Yadav moves inside the line in a bid to whip it towards fine leg but misses. It has been wided
Siraj to Suryakumar Yadav, 1 run, length ball around off, seaming in after pitching, Suryakumar Yadav whips it away to deep mid-wicket for a run
Siraj to Rohit, no run, back of a length ball outside off, Rohit punches it crisply but finds Bracewell at covers
Siraj to Rohit, no run, good length ball just outside off, Rohit punches it towards the left of Siraj and he sticks his hand out to make a stop in his followthrough
Siraj to Rohit, no run, Rohit uses his feet and Siraj bowls a length ball which angles in. He looks to pull it away but misses

Siraj to Rohit, no run,  Short ball around off, Rohit looks to pull it across but gets a top edge. Siraj runs in so does Karthik. Siraj gets his hands on the ball but can't keep his control as both are ball-watching and hence, they collide with each other. Siraj is down
A bit of hold up in play. It is good to see Siraj fine and ready to bowl again
Siraj to Rohit, no run, pitched up ball around off, Rohit drives it crisply but finds mid-on

Akash Deep to Suryakumar Yadav, 1 run, brilliant fielding by Topley! Length ball outside off, Suryakumar Yadav pushes at it with hard hands and gets it off the outer half of bat. Topley at short third man dives to his right to stop a certain boundary
Even though Ishan Kishan is destructive, he has really not improved upon his strike rotation abilities for years. Dot balls creates pressure which eventually results in risky shots off good balls.
Akash Deep to Rohit,  Caught!!

Akash Deep to Rohit,  Caught by Karthik!!  A good length ball just outside off and it seams away. Rohit pushes at it with minimal foot movement and only manages an edge behind. Karthik takes a regulation catch. Slip had moved out so he wanted to place it in the gap between the keeper and short third man. Fails in his attempt. MI are in a precarious situation now.
Akash Deep to Tilak Varma, no run, length ball angling across Tilak Varma as he taps it to point
Akash Deep to Tilak Varma,  Tilak Varma doesn't need sighters. Tilak Varma uses his long levers and tonks this one over long-on for a maximum. That came right off the meat of the bat
Akash Deep to Tilak Varma, 1 run, back of a length ball outside off, nips away slightly, Tilak Varma runs it down to third man

Akash Deep to Suryakumar Yadav, 2 runs, fuller length ball outside off, Suryakumar Yadav slices it with an open bat face towards deep backward point. Topley in the deep moves to his left and slides to make a very good stop. A couple results

Akash Deep to Suryakumar Yadav, 2 runs, fuller length ball outside off, Suryakumar Yadav slices it with an open bat face towards deep backward point. Topley in the deep moves to his left and slides to make a very good stop. A couple results
A brilliant powerplay for RCB! Harshal Patel comes in for a bowl now
Harshal Patel to Tilak Varma, 1 run, Harshal Patel bowls a fuller length ball outside off from round the wicket, Tilak Varma leans into it and places it towards deep point
Harshal Patel to Suryakumar Yadav, 1 run, angling in from a length outside off, Suryakumar opens his bat face to place it towards deep backward point

Harshal Patel to Tilak Varma, , nicely done! Back of a length ball on leg, Tilak Varma gets on top of the bounce and pulls it past the right side of short fine leg. No chance for deep backward square leg to cut it off
Harshal Patel to Tilak Varma, 1 run, on a length on leg, tucked off the back foot towards wide mid-on

Harshal Patel to Suryakumar Yadav, no run, the back of the hand slower ball outside off, Suryakumar Yadav looks to force it through square of the wicket on the off-side but is beaten by the lack of pace

Harshal Patel to Suryakumar Yadav, 1 run, on a length outside off, Suryakumar Yadav chips it uppishly past the left side of the bowler. Faf dives to his right to make a good stop as the batters cross across safely

Karn Sharma to Suryakumar Yadav, 2 runs, full ball on leg, clipped nicely towards deep mid-wicket, Faf moves to his right, shows some good skills with his foot and keeps the ball in play. A couple taken
Karn Sharma to Suryakumar Yadav, 1 run, tossed up ball on middle, Suryakumar Yadav stays leg side of the ball and strokes it to sweeper cover

Karn Sharma to Tilak Varma, 1 run, tossed up ball on leg, Tilak Varma steps down the track and glances it towards fine leg. Topley gets across to his left and dives to stop the ball. But he has landed awkwardly on his right shoulder, looks to be in a lot of pain
It is a cause of concern for him as well as for RCB. The physio is having a chat with him as he goes off the field. Shoulder is a sensitive part but hopefully, he will be fine
Karn Sharma to Suryakumar Yadav, 1 run, tossed up ball, it's the googly, knocked down to long-on
Karn Sharma to Tilak Varma, 1 run, fraction short in length, pulled to deep mid-wicket where Kohli stops it. The crowd cheers for him
Karn Sharma to Suryakumar Yadav, no run, quicker and flatter down leg, Suryakumar looks to tuck it away but is hit on the pads
M Bracewell to Tilak Varma, no run, on a length outside off, cut away towards point
M Bracewell to Tilak Varma, no run, on a length outside off, cut away towards point
M Bracewell to Tilak Varma, 1 run, on a length on middle and off, Tilak Varma works it against the spin to deep mid-wicket
M Bracewell to Suryakumar Yadav, no run, slower through the air and on a length outside off, spinning in. Suryakumar Yadav cuts it off his stumps towards backward point

M Bracewell to Suryakumar Yadav, , tossed up ball wide outside off, Suryakumar Yadav reaches out to it and lofts it over extra cover. The sweeper cover fielder puts in a dive to his right but can't stop it
M Bracewell to Suryakumar Yadav,  Caught!!

M Bracewell to Suryakumar Yadav,  Caught by Shahbaz Ahmed!! Suryakumar Yadav had got off to a start tonight but he finds a way to get himself out. That's what happens when you don't have runs under your belt. A harmless short ball outside off, Suryakumar Yadav rocks back and cuts it but doesn't bother to keep it down. The ball flies towards Shahbaz at backward point and he pouches it safely.

RCB keep chipping away at the wickets. MI don't have any sort of rhythm going. The scoring-rate is also poor as they have been pushed back constantly by the RCB bowlers. They need a big partnership to get some momentum

M Bracewell to Nehal Wadhera, , slower through the air and on a length outside off, Nehal Wadhera places it past the slip fielder. The fielder from backward point gives it a chase and slides near the fence but the ball wins the race.
Karn Sharma to Tilak Varma, 1 run, Tilak Varma uses his feet and drills the tossed up ball to long-off
Karn Sharma to Nehal Wadhera, no run, full ball on middle and leg, Nehal Wadhera strokes it to extra cover
Karn Sharma to Nehal Wadhera, no run, the googly on a length on off, Nehal Wadhera pushes it back to the bowler

RCB review against a lbw decision. It was a conference between Karn Sharma, Maxwell, and Karthik. Faf asked what he should do from near the fence and he was told by Karthik to take the review. Just in time. UltraEdge shows no bat involved. Well, Ball Tracking shows it pitched outside leg and that's the end of the story

Karn Sharma to Nehal Wadhera, no run,  A length ball around leg, Nehal Wadhera looks to work it across but is hit on the front pad. After a lot of deliberation, Faf takes the review as Karthik signalled him to do that. The replay shows it pitched outside leg
Karn Sharma to Nehal Wadhera, 1 run, Nehal Wadhera turns this one to mid-wicket for a single
Karn Sharma to Tilak Varma, 1 run, a short ball outside off, cut away towards deep point
M Bracewell to Tilak Varma, , superb from Tilak Varma, turns himself around, it's tossed up on leg-stump, he reverse-sweeps over backward point and gets it away for four
M Bracewell to Tilak Varma, 2 runs, unlucky for Bracewell, tossed up on the stumps, Tilak Varma gets forward to defend, a thick inside-edge escapes wide of leg-stump and wide of short fine-leg
M Bracewell to Tilak Varma, no run, flat on the stumps, Tilak Varma makes room to dab and does not get it wide of DK
M Bracewell to Tilak Varma, no run, nice flight on this, drops and dips on Tilak Varma as he comes down the track to push to cover
M Bracewell to Tilak Varma, no run, nice flight on this, drops and dips on Tilak Varma as he comes down the track to push to cover
M Bracewell to Tilak Varma, 1 run, flat back of a length on off, Tilak Varma punches to deep point, slight fumble from Harshal but no damage done
M Bracewell to Nehal Wadhera, no run, Bracewell cramps Nehal Wadhera up as the batter made room outside the leg-stump, the flat delivery on the stumps is mistimed to cover
Maxwell to Tilak Varma, , Tilak Varma welcomes Maxwell with a six. Tossed up on the stumps, he comes down the track and lofts clean over long-on for six
Maxwell to Tilak Varma, , superb use of the feet, Maxwell dragged the length back, back of a length on the stumps, Tilak Varma goes on the back foot and pulls hard and wide of deep mid-wicket
Maxwell to Tilak Varma, , slowed it up outside off, the turn away takes it outside the tramline as Tilak Varma aborts the cut, called a wide and does not please Maxwell
Maxwell to Tilak Varma, 1 run, tossed up outside off, Tilak Varma dabs in front of backward point and takes a quick single
Maxwell to Nehal Wadhera, 1 run, Maxwell is appealing for an LBW, but it clearly has taken the top-edge, Nehal Wadhera gets across and sweeps, luckily the top-edge does not carry to short fine-leg

Maxwell to Tilak Varma, 1 run, Nehal Wadhera looks to be in strife. He is on his haunches and the physio is out. Has he twisted his ankle as he looked to turn for the 2nd? Tossed up outside off, Tilak Varma wanted to go over extra-cover but it takes a thick inside-edge and Kohli at long-on keeps it to one
Nehal Wadhera is fine

Maxwell to Nehal Wadhera, 2 runs, length ball outside off, cut wide of sweeper cover and Siraj gets across and cuts it off with a tumble, Nehal Wadhera is in and the throw from Siraj to Karthik is a tad too late

Akash Deep to Tilak Varma, , Tilak Varma is lucky, he was down on his haunches looking for the scoop, but it takes the glove and runs away to third man beating the fielder. Akash Deep looks on puzzled
Akash Deep to Tilak Varma, no run, back of a length on the stumps, Tilak Varma makes room and cuts to cover
Definite intent from Tilak Varma to go for the jugular here. He is trying to take the bowlers on. Akash Deep is not happy with someone in the field, he pulls out.
Akash Deep to Tilak Varma, no run, good short ball, dug in at pace, beats Tilak Varma on the pull, he was a tad too early into the shot
Akash Deep to Tilak Varma, 1 run, back of a length on the stumps, tucked to deep backward square leg
Akash Deep to Nehal Wadhera, 1 run, slower ball short ball on the stumps, pulled hard and straight to deep square leg
Akash Deep to Tilak Varma, 1 run, full outside off, Tilak Varma drills it down to long-on
Akash Deep to Tilak Varma, 1 run, full outside off, Tilak Varma drills it down to long-on
Karn Sharma to Tilak Varma, 1 run, tossed up full outside the leg-stump, Tilak Varma gets forward to flick to deep mid-wicket
Karn Sharma to Nehal Wadhera, no run, tossed up legbreak full outside the leg-stump, Nehal Wadhera misses the slogsweep
Every ball Tilak Varma is talking to Nehal Wadhera and advising him.
Karn Sharma to Nehal Wadhera, , dragged down on the stumps, Nehal Wadhera goes on the back foot and pulls meatily over deep mid-wicket, was a poor delivery and Wadhera cashed in
Karn Sharma to Nehal Wadhera, ,  Tilak Varma hugs Nehal Wadhera. It was flighted outside off, Nehal Wadhera gets forward and uses his long levers, a massive massive hit
A fresh ball please. Nehal Wadhera was pumped after that last six. The 50-run stand is up as well
Karn Sharma to Nehal Wadhera,  Caught!!

Karn Sharma to Nehal Wadhera,  Caught by Kohli!! Karn Sharma has the last laugh. Tosses it up full and Nehal Wadhera can't get under this, gets forward to loft and it's a flat hit straight to the fielder at long-on. Kohli won't drop that. Good cameo but he has to go now.
Karn Sharma to Tim David, 1 run, a slip in for Tim David, flat length delivery on off, punched to long-on
Harshal Patel to Tim David, 1 run, fullish and inswing into Tim David who gets forward to push to long-on
Harshal Patel to Tilak Varma, 1 run, slower ball off-cutter on leg-stump, flicked to backward square leg for one
Harshal Patel to Tim David, no run, back of a length outside off, Tim David checks his punch and nearly chips it back to Harshal Patel, on the bounce to Harshal

Harshal Patel to Tim David, no run, back of a length outside off, Tim David gets forward and punches firmly, but extra-cover gets across and cuts it off to his left. Saved two at least. Suyash the sub there
Harshal Patel to Tim David, 1 run, short outside off, Tim David mistimes the pull to deep square leg
Harshal Patel to Tilak Varma, no run, good pacy short ball, dug in and flies past Tilak Varma who barely had time to react as he went for the pull

! RCB need to ensure they don't let MI away in these last 5 overs. We all know what Tim David can do and Tilak Varma is looking really good too. But one wicket and there's not much batting left for MI.
Karn Sharma to Tim David, 1 run, flat and pushed through on a length just outside off, Tim David forces it off the back foot to deep cover
Karn Sharma to Tilak Varma, 1 run, tossed up very full outside the leg-stump, flicked to deep mid-wicket and the call was for two from Tilak Varma but Tim David with a loud shout of "no"
Karn Sharma to Tim David, , slower and wider outside off, turns away, left alone and the wide taken
Karn Sharma to Tim David,  Bowled!!

Karn Sharma to Tim David,  Bowled!! Karn Sharma punches the air in delight. Drifts into middle and leg, turns away after pitching, Tim David aims for a big slogsweep and misses, the stumps are messed up. Big wicket that. Now RCB can pile on the pressure.
Karn Sharma to Hrithik Shokeen, 1 run, good length legbreak on off and middle, tucked to deep backward square leg and Tilak Varma sends Hrithik Shokeen back for the 2nd
Karn Sharma to Tilak Varma, 1 run, flat length on the middle and leg line, nudged to deep backward square leg
Karn Sharma to Hrithik Shokeen, , poor delivery, short and down leg, Hrithik Shokeen went low and pulls it away to the fine-leg fence, placed it to get a handy boundary

Tilak Varma is absolutely phenomenal. The positive approach, the patience, the elegance, the way he's communicating with Nehal and making him familiar with the game on his debut...signs of a great player in the making. Hoping to see more of him this year. One of the best finds of the IPL

Akash Deep to Tilak Varma, ,  A back of a length delivery on the stumps, Tilak Varma slugs it away over deep square leg, nearly into the second tier. Points to the MI crest on his jersey and pumps his fist
Akash Deep to Tilak Varma, no run, good comeback, slower short ball across Tilak Varma who slashes and misses
Akash Deep to Tilak Varma, no run, very full on the stumps, whipped straight to the fielder at mid-wicket. Another dot

Akash Deep to Tilak Varma, no run, Tilak Varma moves across his stumps, but this wide yorker is still further away, left alone and a wide called. But . Clearly wide of the tramline on the off-side - let's see what the third ump decides.  of Tilak as he has moved across with his left foot outside the off-stump. A dot and DK was the man who has to get the credit for that
Akash Deep to Tilak Varma, , slower short ball at Tilak Varma who pulls and the top-edge flies away to the fine-leg fence
Akash Deep to Tilak Varma, 2 runs, a low full-toss on the stumps, Tilak Varma is early into the flick, the thick leading-edge falls in front of long-on and they come back for two
Harshal Patel to Hrithik Shokeen,  Caught!!

Harshal Patel to Hrithik Shokeen,  Caught by du Plessis!! Superb catch by Faf at mid-off. Full outside off, Hrithik Shokeen gets forward and actually lofts well, but Faf anticipated it well and moved back to take it over his shoulder as he cups it with two hands and tumbles to ground. Made it simple due to his athletic ability.
Harshal Patel to Arshad Khan, 1 run, the slower ball is a low full-toss on the stumps, heaved to deep mid-wicket
Harshal Patel to Tilak Varma, , this is a wide outside off, left alone and DK can't stop it. Karn Sharma at short third man had he hit direct, could have got Arshad Khan. Was a close shave

Harshal Patel to Arshad Khan, 2 runs, another low full-toss outside off, swung away wide of Kohli at long-on who gets across and cuts it off with a dive, gets up and fires in a precise throw on the bounce to DK, but can't prevent the 2nd
Harshal Patel to Arshad Khan, 1 run, back of a length on the stumps, Arshad Khan according to the ump got an inside-edge onto the thigh, they run a quick single as the ball stays on the pitch
Harshal Patel to Tilak Varma, no run, a fine off-cutter slower ball, dips and drops on Tilak Varma who gets forward to drive and is beaten, just wide of off-stump
Harshal Patel to Tilak Varma, ,  length delivery and width outside off, bad ball, Tilak Varma scythes it hard and to the sweeper cover fence. Faf has a word with Harshal Patel after that
Wide ball review. One of the stupidest decisions by IPL yet. I am certain they will eventually do away with on field umpires. All decisions will be delivered by TV umpire. You read it here first!
Siraj to Arshad Khan, no run, pacy back of a length delivery outside off, zips past Arshad Khan who pulls and misses, flies past off-stump
Tilak Varma walks up to Arshad Khan to have a word. Strike should be Tilak Varma's for MI's benefit
Siraj to Arshad Khan, 1 run, full outside off, Arshad Khan drives to deep point and turns the strike over
Siraj to Tilak Varma, , short and wide outside off, Tilak Varma reaches for it to slash and misses, wide called. Was wide too
Fine-leg, long-on, deep square leg and two men at deep point are the 5 men out.
Siraj to Tilak Varma, , another wide. Siraj gets this wide line outside off way wrong
Siraj to Tilak Varma, , hat-trick of wides. Dug in short outside off, too short and Tilak Varma misses the slash
Faf with a smile wants to have a word with Siraj
Siraj to Tilak Varma, , way outside off and that's four in a row
Siraj to Tilak Varma, , way outside off and that's four in a row
Such poor game-sense from Siraj. He is unnecessarily putting pressure on his team
Siraj to Tilak Varma, 2 runs, fullish just outside off, Tilak Varma heaves wide of Kohli at long-on and comes back for the second
Siraj to Tilak Varma, , nice. Mid-off was up and Tilak Varma comes down the track, gets outside the leg-stump and lofts the length delivery with a straight bat wide of mid-off
Siraj to Tilak Varma, , back to wides. The wide outside off line misses its radar again
Faf can just have a wry smile at the moment. A change in field. Mid-wicket goes back
Siraj to Tilak Varma, , Tilak Varma is turning it on. Deep square leg was in, this is a length delivery on the stumps, dragged wide of that man and into the gap, was more of a thick inside-edge
Siraj to Tilak Varma, no run, finally gets one right. Full and inside the tramline on the off-side, Tilak Varma reaches for it and can't lay bat on ball on the drive
Harshal Patel to Arshad Khan, 2 runs, full on the pads, flicked away wide of deep mid-wicket and they take two. 150 comes up

Harshal Patel to Arshad Khan, , Arshad Khan can strike them. He stands back and hammers the back of a length delivery just outside off flat over deep mid-wicket. A powerful biff that one. Even Faf is left with his mouth open "ooohing" in admiration
Harshal Patel to Arshad Khan, 1 run, a low full-toss outside off, Arshad Khan drags it to long-on and gives Tilak Varma the strike
Harshal Patel to Tilak Varma, , slower short ball at Tilak Varma who does well to control the pull, places it through square leg and beats Bracewell to his right from deep backward square leg

Harshal Patel to Tilak Varma, , 1 run, over the waist no-ball as the full-toss slips out, Tilak Varma is surprised and can only find cover.  - but will lose it, as it is over the waist and clearly over
Harshal Patel to Arshad Khan, 1 run, another low full-toss on the stumps, Arshad Khan only find deep mid-wicket with a flick. Was another ball begging to be hit

Harshal Patel to Tilak Varma, , Tilak Varma ends on a high. The slower ball full on the stumps, Tilak Varma gets forward and helicopters the flick, just clears long-on and that is a fine end to MI's innings

Tilak Varma punches the air as he runs off. What a knock it has been from him. MI looked down and out at 20-3 and when SKY got out at 48-4 but Tilak has stood tall and single-handedly almost steered his side over 170. It may still not be enough but Tilak has shown his temperament and skill tonight. Failures for MI's big guns and good bowling from Karn Sharma and Michael Bracewell in the middle put pressure on MI but the last 4 overs have produced 60 and turned the momentum around. Handy cameos from Nehal Wadhera and Arshad Khan but it is Tilak who stole the show. RCB will be disappointed to have let things slip away, but they know with their batting, they can chase this down. Back for the chase shortly...

My plan was to adjust to the wicket and see how it was doing. It was holding a bit. So, I took my time initially and then see how it goes. My mindset was positive and I was constantly talking to my partners and asking them what a good score would be. The ball from the spinners were holding up a bit. So, they were a little tough as compared to the pacers. I was thinking that he can bowl wide yorkers. He was under pressure. I was just backing myself to punish him if he missed, so he was under pressure there.
Welcome back. MI in a huddle. Out walk Kohli and Faf. . Can the Aussie get it to swing? If he does, he will be a threat. Kohli is standing outside his crease. A slip in for the pacer.
Behrendorff to Kohli, 1 run, Kohli is off the mark, good length on off, he gets forward and defends wide of backward point who dives to his left but can't stop it
Behrendorff to du Plessis, no run, good length and straight, on middle-stump, defended to backward point
So far no swing for Behrendorff
Behrendorff to du Plessis, 1 run, full on the stumps, du Plessis' bottom-hand takes over and he drives it wide of mid-off for one
Shouts of "Kohli, Kohli" ring around the Chinnaswamy
Behrendorff to Kohli, 1 run, Kohli gets forward and is down the track, defends the length delivery wide of cover for a quick single
Behrendorff to Kohli, 1 run, Kohli gets forward and is down the track, defends the length delivery wide of cover for a quick single
Behrendorff to du Plessis, 2 runs, back of a length on the stumps, turned to fine-leg and Faf comes back for the 2nd
SKY's night is done - he is relaxing and passing on some tips to a youngster seated next to him in the dugout.
Behrendorff to du Plessis, no run, good length and tight on the stumps, du Plessis with a forward defence
Jofra vs Kohli will be a mouthwatering contest!!
Arshad Khan to Kohli, , swing for Arshad Khan but starts down leg and goes further, Kohli flicks and misses
Arshad Khan to Kohli, , and again, the length is shortened but the line is down leg, Kohli flicks and misses
Arshad Khan to Kohli, , hat-trick of wides down leg, Kohli flicks and misses
Arshad Khan to Kohli, no run, , full and gets the radar right, inswing for Arshad Khan, Kohli gets forward to drive and the inside-edge strikes the back thigh and rolls near his feet
Arshad Khan to Kohli, , too straight and that's into Kohli's strength, full inswinger on middle-stump, flicked wide of short fine-leg, who dives to his left but cant' get there
Arshad Khan to Kohli, no run, fullish outside off, Kohli charges Arshad Khan and mistimes the drive to cover
Arshad Khan to Kohli, 1 run, full on the pads, flicked away wristily to deep backward square leg
Arshad Khan to du Plessis, leg byes, 1 run, lovely inswinging yorker that has du Plessis on the floor, swings in wickedly as du Plessis flicks and misses, impact is outside the leg-stump though
Arshad Khan to Kohli, no run, Kohli uses his feet and drills the full delivery straight to the fielder at mid-on, timed it well but did not find the gap
Behrendorff to du Plessis, , all timing. du Plessis comes down the track and meets the length delivery on the rise, timed the cover drive past the off-side field
Behrendorff to du Plessis, no run, . A short of length delivery that nips back in ever so slightly, du Plessis was looking to dab that and misses, just wide of off-stump

Behrendorff to du Plessis, , du Plessis has been in fine nick in all the T20 leagues around the world recently. Gives Behrendorff the charge and flicks the length delivery over mid-wicket, all the way
Behrendorff to du Plessis, , another one. A slower ball on a fuller length outside off, in the slot, du Plessis stays back and hammers it over long-off. Another clean strike
Behrendorff to du Plessis, no run, pitches outside the leg-stump, cramps du Plessis for room, he flicks and misses
Behrendorff to du Plessis, no run, pitches outside the leg-stump, cramps du Plessis for room, he flicks and misses
Behrendorff to du Plessis, no run, with short fine-leg inside, du Plessis goes down on one knee and tries the scoop, misses, wants a leg-side wide but gets nothing

suprising impact player choice by MI, SKY is a gun fielder. Playing Behrendroff from the start and getting Piyush only when he was needed to bowl would have made more sense as a fielding unit, right ?

Jofra Archer to Kohli, no run,  A hard length delivery outside off, Kohli makes room and miscues the drive, went to Jofra Archer's left, who did not get down in time to snaffle that. Was not anticipating that. Got hands and dropped it
Jofra Archer to Kohli, , back of a length outside off, Kohli stays besides the line of the ball and guides it between backward point and short third man, pure placement that
Jofra Archer to Kohli, no run, pacy delivery this. Fires it on a short of length outside off, extra bounce, Kohli tries to slash and misses, flies to Ishan Kishan
Jofra Archer to Kohli, no run, hits a hard back of a length on off, Kohli gets forward to defend to cover
Jofra Archer to Kohli, , a flat six. Kohli takes on Jofra Archer and sends him over long-off. Was the leg-cutter slower ball outside off and Kohli comes down the track to slam it flat
Jofra Archer to Kohli, no run, fullish outside off, Kohli gets forward to drive nicely but cover fields. Good shot for no run
Chawla to du Plessis, no run, flat and into the pitch on the stumps, du Plessis mistimes the pull to backward square leg
Chawla to du Plessis, no run, quicker good length delivery on the middle and leg line, turned to backward square leg
Chawla to du Plessis, no run, the attempted googly is quicker outside off, flat-batted cut to cover. Three dots in a row
Chawla to du Plessis, , in the gap and wide of the off-side field. A good length delivery outside off, du Plessis cuts and picks the gap at extra-cover

Chawla to du Plessis, no run, good ball and beats du Plessis on the slash, Ishan too fumbles, tossed up googly outside off, does not turn back in enough to hit off-stump. Hang on - , so would have been a wicket
Chawla to du Plessis, 1 run, the front of the hand dart on off, du Plessis punches to mid-wicket and takes a single
Jofra Archer to du Plessis, 1 run, back of a length on off, du Plessis stays besides the line to tap through cover-point
Jofra Archer to Kohli, no run, full on off, there's that trademark Kohli check-drive, but mid-off gets across and cuts it off with a dive

Jofra Archer to Kohli, , that's Kohli at his very best. Picked up the back of a length delivery outside off so quickly, transferred the weight back but was on the front foot to pull over mid-wicket. Authoritative
Jofra Archer to Kohli, 1 run, short of length just outside off, dabbed wide of backward point for an easy single
Jofra Archer to Kohli, 1 run, short of length just outside off, dabbed wide of backward point for an easy single

Pritam the only logic behind that would be is that except for Rohit and SKY, rest of the MI lineup have got players who can bowl at least 1 over, given that their bowling attack heavily depends on Archer, the skipper would like to have maximum number of options possible at his disposal.
Faf and Kohli are batting with intent and purpose
Jofra Archer to du Plessis, 1 run, back of a length and into the pitch, du Plessis is cramped up and his flapping pull just clears square leg going back
Jofra Archer to Kohli, 1 run, good length on the stumps, drop and run to mid-on and that's a great powerplay for RCB
Chawla to Kohli, no run, good length on off, punched and Rohit at cover dives to his right to make a fine stop
Chawla to Kohli, 1 run, the attempted googly outside off, dabbed wide of short third man
Chawla to du Plessis, 1 run, good length on the stumps, clipped away to deep mid-wicket for one
Chawla to Kohli, 1 run, no spin, full on off, Kohli gets forward to drive to long-off
Chawla to du Plessis, 1 run, another googly on the stumps, du Plessis punches wide of Chawla
Chawla to Kohli, 1 run, fullish on the stumps, Kohli gets forward to defend wide of cover for a quick single
Green to Kohli, 1 run, back of a length on the stumps, Kohli stays leg-side of the ball and punches wide of backward point for one
Green to du Plessis, , superb from du Plessis. Fullish on off, du Plessis gets forward and drives between cover and mid-off, he looks in great nick

Green to du Plessis, no run, dug in short on the stumps, du Plessis pulls and misses, du Plessis wants one short ball for the over from Nitin Menon, but gets nothing. du Plessis and Kohli are in splits at that call
Green to du Plessis, 2 runs, good length angling into off-stump, heaved away to deep backward square leg, where the fielder does well to prevent the four
Green to du Plessis, , poor ball. Green tried the slower off-cutter into the pitch, width was there, slashed over cover

Green to du Plessis, , big over this. du Plessis shuffles across nonchalantly and picks the length delivery from the stumps, scoops it all the way over fine-leg - 17 off the over. Audacious batting and MI are in trouble
Chawla to Kohli, , tossed up full on the stumps and too full actually, Kohli gets forward and drives straight down the ground and takes four
Chawla to Kohli, no run, slower legbreak outside off, Kohli tries to go hard on the cover drive and inside-edges it back to Chawla
Chawla to Kohli, no run, slower legbreak outside off, Kohli tries to go hard on the cover drive and inside-edges it back to Chawla
Chawla to Kohli, no run, fraction short outside off, cut straight to the fielder at backward point
Chawla to Kohli, 1 run, du Plessis did not move till the ball passed Rohit at cover, had Rohit fielded that, du Plessis was in big trouble
Chawla to du Plessis, no run,  Rohit does not take the review. The googly and du Plessis is caught on the back foot as he misses the nudge, impact on leg-stump and easily sliding down
Chawla to du Plessis, no run, tossed up outside off, spins back in and is inside the line on the off-side, left alone and that's the  as well

MI's opening game woes look set to continue. RCB sauntering in this chase. And you can score even 100 here off the last 5 overs if you have a great night. MI need a minor miracle to win this one from here.
Hrithik Shokeen to Kohli, 2 runs, slower offbreak on middle-stump, swung away to deep backward square leg and Tilak does well on the dive to save the four
Hrithik Shokeen to Kohli, 1 run, wide of the crease and tossed up on off, Kohli eases it down to long-on
Hrithik Shokeen to du Plessis, , that's into du Plessis' range.  A tossed up offbreak on off, he gets forward and slogsweeps over deep mid-wicket, the ball flies away
Hrithik Shokeen to du Plessis, , in the slot and the long levers of du Plessis comes into play. Full on the stumps, du Plessis clears his front leg and smashes it over long-on
Hrithik Shokeen to du Plessis, 1 run, Hrithik Shokeen shifts to round the wicket, flatter delivery on the stumps, tucked away to deep mid-wicket
Hrithik Shokeen to Kohli, 1 run, flat good length on the stumps, tucked away wide of mid-wicket
Chawla to Kohli, no run, pushed quicker onto off. Kohli tries a tap and run towards point but the fielder is alert
Chawla to Kohli, 2 runs, generously flighted, hammered hard and straight as an arrow - deflects off the non-striker's stumps to the right of long-on
Chawla to Kohli, , given some flight again, and this in the arc for Virat Kohli.
Chawla to Kohli, 1 run, fuller on off, driven towards long-off
Chawla to du Plessis, no run, pitched up, du Plessis strides closer to punch towards extra cover
Chawla to du Plessis, 2 runs, flighted and straight, du Plessis inside halves his big slog to the left of deep mid-wicket. Two runs taken
Faf's love with IPL continues, one of the most consistent performers over

Jofra Archer to Kohli, 2 runs, back of a length onto off, Kohli with a gentle push towards mid-wicket. So quick between the wickets to complete two runs with that stroke. There was a direct hit but Faf was back by then
Jofra Archer to Kohli, no run, short onto off, extra bounce. Kohli defends off the splice to the left of the bowler
after Chris Gayle and Mayank Agarwal's 113-run stand in the 2011 Qualifier 2 in Chennai.
Jofra Archer to Kohli, 2 runs, slower delivery that was pitched up, driven towards deep extra for another couple of runs...
Jofra Archer to Kohli, no run, short on the body, Kohli ducks under
Jofra Archer to Kohli, 1 run, good length and straight, pushed down the ground past Archer for a single.
Jofra Archer to du Plessis, no run, slower length ball, cut into the pitch and back to Archer. Du Plessis is vexed he didn't get that ball away
Behrendorff to Kohli, , banged short onto middle and leg. Kohli reads early and steps out to pull through cow corner. One bounce and into the fence...
Behrendorff to Kohli, 1 run, yorker length as Kohli charged out again. Thick leading edge on his clip takes the ball towards long-off
Behrendorff to du Plessis, , slower bouncer, Du Plessis gauged the length really early, held back in his crease and heaved his pull over deep mid-wicket!!
Behrendorff to du Plessis, , full but angling onto the pads from round the wicket. A gentle glance through deep backward square leg by Faf du Plessis. Four more!
Behrendorff to du Plessis, no run, yorker on off, stabbed towards the non-striker's stumps and deflects towards Rohit at extra cover
Fun Fact: MI Last won their opening match back in 2012. In the same season their Specialist Spinner Piyush Chawla won his team KKR their first Title with a match winning boundary !!
Behrendorff to du Plessis, 1 run, full on off, du Plessis with an uppish push towards deep cover. Gets to the fielder on the bounce
Jofra Archer to du Plessis, 2 runs, good length on off, cut towards sweeper cover for a couple of runs
Run a ball needed now
Jofra Archer to du Plessis, 1 run, slower delivery with a straight line, turned to mid-wicket
Jofra Archer to Kohli, , short and tried to test Kohli with the extra pace on the body. The former RCB captain says thank you very much and effortlessly pulls over deep square leg for a sixer!!
Jofra Archer to Kohli, , short and tried to test Kohli with the extra pace on the body. The former RCB captain says thank you very much and effortlessly pulls over deep square leg for a sixer!!
Jofra Archer to Kohli, 1 run, short again, pulled along the ground towards deep mid-wicket
Jofra Archer to du Plessis, no run, full and straight, driven towards mid-off
Jofra Archer to du Plessis, no run, short outside off, dabbed towards backward point
RCB are cruising, on fourth gear with their feet up. MI need to find a breakthrough - 2 wicket and this soft middle-order can be tested.

Arshad Khan to Kohli, , What a hit!! In all fairness a slot ball on middle by Arshad Khan, Kohli clears his leg and gives it an almighty swing over deep mid-wicket. That was six on any ground, forget the smallest IPL ground...
Change of balls
Arshad Khan to Kohli, 2 runs, Dropped!! This was the chance. It was a full delivery on the pads, flicked straight to Hritik Shokeen at deep mid-wicket. Pops in and out his hand...
Arshad Khan to Kohli, no run, short pitched and goes over the shoulder as Kohli tried a pull
Arshad Khan to Kohli, 1 run, low full toss, driven down the ground but David from long-on will cut it off
Arshad Khan to du Plessis,  Caught!!

Arshad Khan to du Plessis,  Caught by Tim David!! Finally a wicket!! This was the slower length ball, Faf is beaten by the lack of pace. Goes through his slog a bit too early and gets no timing. Goes high but lands in the hands of Tim David at long-on.
Arshad Khan to Karthik, no run, full and straight, driven back to the bowler
The designated RCB finisher gets a promotion today. Eyeing net run rate already?
Green to Kohli, 1 run, low full toss, Kohli shuffles in to clip towards deep backward square leg
Green to Kohli, 1 run, low full toss, Kohli shuffles in to clip towards deep backward square leg
Green to Kohli, 1 run, low full toss, Kohli shuffles in to clip towards deep backward square leg
Green to Karthik, no run, full on off, Karthik wanted to go over mid-off but timing eludes him. Falls tamely towards the fielder after a couple of bounces
Green to Karthik, no run, full on off, Karthik wanted to go over mid-off but timing eludes him. Falls tamely towards the fielder after a couple of bounces

Green to Karthik,  Caught!!
Green to Karthik,  Caught!!

Green to Karthik,  Caught by Tilak Varma!! Oops, not to be for DK. This was pitched up on the pads, Karthik tries a flick but holes out straight to deep square leg. Tilak Varma completes a regulation catch.

Green to Karthik,  Caught by Tilak Varma!! Oops, not to be for DK. This was pitched up on the pads, Karthik tries a flick but holes out straight to deep square leg. Tilak Varma completes a regulation catch.
Green to Maxwell, no run, short on the body, a very flimsy heave from Maxwell that goes nowhere. Lands tamely towards mid-on after pitching
Green to Maxwell, no run, short on the body, a very flimsy heave from Maxwell that goes nowhere. Lands tamely towards mid-on after pitching

Green to Maxwell, , That's one way to get off the mark!! Maxi isn't going to wait around here, this was short of length outside off, the Aussie all-rounder stays leg side and slaps it over deep extra cover. Complete backhand power on that one!!

Green to Maxwell, , That's one way to get off the mark!! Maxi isn't going to wait around here, this was short of length outside off, the Aussie all-rounder stays leg side and slaps it over deep extra cover. Complete backhand power on that one!!
Green to Maxwell, , Six more!! Green goes short on the body, Maxwell backs away and pulls over fine leg. Didn't come off the middle but who cares? Easily clears the man in the deep
Green to Maxwell, , Six more!! Green goes short on the body, Maxwell backs away and pulls over fine leg. Didn't come off the middle but who cares? Easily clears the man in the deep
Arshad Khan to Kohli, , length ball on the pads, Kohli with a late whip that beats the fine leg fielder in the circle and keeps running away from deep backward square leg
Arshad Khan to Kohli, , length ball on the pads, Kohli with a late whip that beats the fine leg fielder in the circle and keeps running away from deep backward square leg
Arshad Khan to Kohli, , short, too short and called wide
Arshad Khan to Kohli, , short, too short and called wide
One hit away now...
One hit away now...
Arshad Khan to Kohli,  Infact, a shot similar to that iconic MSD one on the day India won the World Cup 12 years ago. This is much flatter though, but over long-on and into the stands...
Arshad Khan to Kohli,  Infact, a shot similar to that iconic MSD one on the day India won the World Cup 12 years ago. This is much flatter though, but over long-on and into the stands...

IPL cricket is welcomed back at the M Chinnaswamy Stadium with a resounding win for the hosts. A superb overall performance, their bowlers got them wickets in the powerplay, and then the spinners kept things tight. And then the spotless chase. Faf du Plessis seems to be ageing like Benjamin Button, he is bringing all that SA20 form to the IPL and nobody is complaining. He couldn't quite stay till the end, but got RCB in such a strong position that they couldn't lose. And of course there was Virat Kohli. Hes a showman and he put on a show tonight at his adopted home ground. Kohli is back to playing with a smile on his face, picking up length early and some of those sixes just defined class. He stayed till the end although RCB lost a couple of wickets late on, to get the franchise home with almost four overs to spare...

Some similar problems continue for Mumbai Indians. An underwhelming IPL return for Jofra Archer, and the rest of their bowlers also lacked any real bite. Their top-order too continues to falter. Ishan and Rohit had another bad day, Surya started but couldn't get going. The only positive is Tilak Varma, who actually played a blinder of an innings to get Mumbai a very competitive score after the first innings. A new season, but a sense of deja vu for Rohit and the boys. Let's hear what he has to say now...

Didn’t have a great start with the bat in the first six overs. But, it was a really good effort from Tilak and a few other batters. But, we didn’t execute well with the ball. It was a good pitch to bat on. (On Tilak Verma) He is a positive person, quite talented as well. Some of the shots he played, showed a lot of courage. Hats off to Tilak to get us to a competitive total. It was a good pitch to bat on. We didn’t set any target but we didn't even bat to half of our potential and we got to 170. Probably 30-40 runs more would have been ideal. From the last six to eight months I am used to playing without Jasprit Bumrah.  We can't keep dwelling on it. Injuries are not in our control, we can't do much about it. The other guys in the setup are quite talented as well. We need to give them that support. Just the first game of the season, there's a lot to look forward to.

Probably 30-40 runs more would have been ideal. From the last six to eight months I am used to playing without Jasprit Bumrah.  We can't keep dwelling on it. Injuries are not in our control, we can't do much about it. The other guys in the setup are quite talented as well. We need to give them that support. Just the first game of the season, there's a lot to look forward to.

I thought it was a phenomenal win, a homecoming after 4 years. Couldn't have asked for a better game. We bowled well for the first 17 overs but then credit to their batters especially Tilak who batted really well. It was a very comprehensive win and we wanted to win with balls to spare as it will benefit the NRR. The new ball was tricky, that's where we shifted the momentum, they can ride on that momentum from the last two overs of their batting but the way we started nullified all that momentum. We kept the pressure on the bowlers. Phenomenal, it was a packed crowd, every seat was full when we walked in here. Very important we started off well, their support propelled us and that makes a massive difference. I think he was phenomenal, phenomenal spell from him, that's brave bowling after getting the left-hander out [on Karn Sharma]. He was bowling so well for us last year but he couldn't play. Even in the nets he was not getting hit for sixes, hats off to him for coming and playing after so long, to perform  against such a strong MI side at the Chinnaswamy is great for him. I wanted to mention this for a while - after MI who have 5 titles and CSK who have 4, if I'm not wrong, we are the third team to have qualified the most times to the playoffs - 8 times. Take one game at a time and try to be a balanced side which we are and we would look to execute our plans as we did tonight.

Take one game at a time and try to be a balanced side which we are and we would look to execute our plans as we did tonight.

Nice to start the way we did. In the powerplay, Siraj had the tail up and he set the tone. Right through the innings, our bowlers stuck to the plans. Obviously last 2-3 overs something to improve on. And that second innings, if you want to know how to chase a target, well, that's how you do it. If you took pace off the ball, it wasn't too easy to play and there was something in it for the spinners but as a batter if you got into good positions you could score runs. My first time playing here as a home player and it's a special player, especially batting with Virat Kohli. Energy bounces off him. You have to stay with the youngsters, I still work hard to be able to move around like I could in the young days. The confidence this gives, all of us are confidence players. This start will be huge for us as a team.

Nice to start the way we did. In the powerplay, Siraj had the tail up and he set the tone. Right through the innings, our bowlers stuck to the plans. Obviously last 2-3 overs something to improve on. And that second innings, if you want to know how to chase a target, well, that's how you do it. If you took pace off the ball, it wasn't too easy to play and there was something in it for the spinners but as a batter if you got into good positions you could score runs. My first time playing here as a home player and it's a special player, especially batting with Virat Kohli. Energy bounces off him. You have to stay with the youngsters, I still work hard to be able to move around like I could in the young days. The confidence this gives, all of us are confidence players. This start will be huge for us as a team.

That's all for today. Two fairly one-sided games on this Sunday but that is the luck of the draw in the IPL. The good news is the big guns like Jos Buttler and Virat Kohli are firing from the get-go.
